added_lines: def test_modify_scheduling(self): called = {} class FakeProcess(object): def __init__(self, *args): pass def nice(self, *args): called[self.nice.__name__] = args def ionice(self, *args): called[self.ionice.__name__] = args with patch('swift.common.utils.Process', FakeProcess): called = {} # not set / default utils.modify_scheduling({}) self.assertEqual(called, {}) called = {} # just nice utils.modify_scheduling({'nice_prior': '1'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'nice': (1, )}) called = {} # just ionice class utils.modify_scheduling({'ionice_cls': '2'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'ionice': (2, None)}) called = {} # ionice class & priority utils.modify_scheduling({'ionice_cls': '3', 'ionice_prior': '4'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'ionice': (3, 4)}) called = {} # just ionice priority is ignored utils.modify_scheduling({'ionice_prior': '4'}) self.assertEqual(called, {}) called = {} # nice & ionice class utils.modify_scheduling({'nice_prior': '1', 'ionice_cls': '3'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'nice': (1, ), 'ionice': (3, None)}) called = {} # nice & ionice priority is ignored utils.modify_scheduling({'nice_prior': '1'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'nice': (1, )}) called = {} # all utils.modify_scheduling({'nice_prior': '1', 'ionice_cls': '3', 'ionice_prior': '4'}) self.assertEqual(called, {'nice': (1, ), 'ionice': (3, 4)})

commit_message:
node_ids parameter is interpreted correctly

node_ids parameter cannot be passed to the filter_by() as is so
filter_by_list is used instead.

Change-Id: Ic8561a737347d804deddd8276e8299b23a58a523
Closes-Bug: #1602937
(cherry picked from commit 8daeb5974fd9eb3d4d139bac8cdb25786c4339dc)

added_lines: # List all configurations for specific nodes url = self._make_filter_url( cluster_id=self.clusters[0].id, node_ids=','.join([str(self.nodes[1].id), str(self.nodes[2].id)])) resp = self.app.get(url, headers=self.default_headers) self.assertEqual(resp.status_code, 200) node_ids = set(cfg['node_id'] for cfg in resp.json_body) self.assertEqual(node_ids, set([self.nodes[1].id, self.nodes[2].id]))

subject: Fix encoding of shotgun stdout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 12:35:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/dump.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/90d0aa8ecd1677c9ec00b7ea9ff5e3dee6f9bc51', 'message': "Fix encoding of shotgun stdout

Mcollective uses sustemu module to execute shell commands. This module
doesn't care about encoding and as a result we get shotgun stdout as a
string with ASCII-8BIT encoding. Later we get a failure at the attempt
to encode it to JSON. However, shotgun output depends on locale settings
and is usually UTF-8.

Change-Id: I838f1aa55ea2885c1353a352c537dfe1bcd1e7e3
Closes-Bug: #1604311
"}]
commit_message:
Fix encoding of shotgun stdout

Mcollective uses sustemu module to execute shell commands. This module
doesn't care about encoding and as a result we get shotgun stdout as a
string with ASCII-8BIT encoding. Later we get a failure at the attempt
to encode it to JSON. However, shotgun output depends on locale settings
and is usually UTF-8.

Change-Id: I838f1aa55ea2885c1353a352c537dfe1bcd1e7e3
Closes-Bug: #1604311
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/41/346741/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: report_success(ctx, result[:data][:stdout].force_encoding(Encoding.default_external).rstrip)
deleted_lines: report_success(ctx, result[:data][:stdout].rstrip)

Set up MTU docker interface

Kuryr should load neutron network mtu and set it on interface.
UT will fixed in a seperate patch

Related kuryr-libnetwork patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/355714/

subnets resulted by os subnet list command.

subject: requirements: fix to point to upstream
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 02:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/1963cb4e202247c9e3a3f2148c682ae2972bc733', 'message': "requirements: fix to point to upstream

As a temporary measure, we were pointing to Vikas' fork for kuryr-lib
since he did most of the split work. Kuryr-lib is starting to take good
shape and it is necessary for community guidelines and for devstack
correct operation that we point to OpenStack's own kuryr-lib
(openstack/kuryr) repository.

Additionally, I manually published a development package to pypi for
kuryr-lib so that when devstack's pip install of kuryr-libnetwork tries
to find the kuryr-lib version in pypi, it finds one.

In the future, once kuryr-lib stabilizes, it would be good to operate
like Neutron does with Neutron lib, i.e., point to a specific kuryr-lib
release in requirements. Until then, `pip install -r requirements` will
install from master and `pip install .` will find the pypi wheel.

Change-Id: If9b5da3a1853a6aa1e5ef177952591684c0e6053
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
"}]
commit_message:
requirements: fix to point to upstream

As a temporary measure, we were pointing to Vikas' fork for kuryr-lib
since he did most of the split work. Kuryr-lib is starting to take good
shape and it is necessary for community guidelines and for devstack
correct operation that we point to OpenStack's own kuryr-lib
(openstack/kuryr) repository.

Additionally, I manually published a development package to pypi for
kuryr-lib so that when devstack's pip install of kuryr-libnetwork tries
to find the kuryr-lib version in pypi, it finds one.

In the future, once kuryr-lib stabilizes, it would be good to operate
like Neutron does with Neutron lib, i.e., point to a specific kuryr-lib
release in requirements. Until then, `pip install -r requirements` will
install from master and `pip install .` will find the pypi wheel.

Change-Id: If9b5da3a1853a6aa1e5ef177952591684c0e6053
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/31/356831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: -e git+https://github.com/vikaschoudhary16/kuryr.git@drop_libnet_specific_code#egg=kuryr-lib

Change-Id: I7794d41cd76695afcd97956bf12985801391c0e8
'}]
commit_message:
go: put for objects through buffers

I think this is not good, but I found, that if one of objects nodes not respond (with timeout for example), all io.Copy with multiwriter will fail and return 503.
Different buffers can prevent this, but it is bad for large objects

Change-Id: I7794d41cd76695afcd97956bf12985801391c0e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/30/309830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "bytes" buf1, buf2, buf3 := new(bytes.Buffer), new(bytes.Buffer), new(bytes.Buffer) io.Copy(io.MultiWriter(buf1, buf2, buf3), src) go func() { defer writers[0].Close() io.Copy(writers[0], buf1) }() go func() { defer writers[1].Close() io.Copy(writers[1], buf2) }() go func() { defer writers[2].Close() io.Copy(writers[2], buf3)
deleted_lines: go func() { mw := io.MultiWriter(writers[0], writers[1], writers[2]) io.Copy(mw, src) for _, writer := range writers { writer.Close() }

commit_message:
Don't animate detached popovers for deployment history timeline

Animation causes issues with popovers when create a new popover
when the old one hasn't faded out.

Also, 'trigger' was removed from props since it's used only for
detached mode and always must be 'manual'.

Implements blueprint ui-deployment-history

Change-Id: I4843294ccc0a5e3acc91e6fcb2dc8f405ff70af4

deleted_lines: placement: React.PropTypes.node, trigger: React.PropTypes.node placement: 'bottom', trigger: 'manual' trigger: this.props.trigger,

commit_message:
Add ConsistencyGroup Into Quota Management

ConsistencyGroup has its own quota class and quota usage. But the
ConsistencyGroup quota information wasn't contained in any quota API's
response body. We should show it to users and allow users to update or
delete it.

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Change-Id: Id3c80f8d4f021d7ab05e990d89e262570c761518

commit_message:
Add '--status' option to os network list command

This patch adds '--status' option to filter networks resulted by
os network list command

Change-Id: Ib9e4365353ca1161b3b570f27a2db6203accd82b
Partial-Bug: #1578819
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/59/351059/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_network_list_status(self): test_status = "fakestatus" arglist = [ '--status', test_status, ] verifylist = [ ('long', False), ('status', test_status), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.networks.assert_called_once_with( **{'status': test_status} ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data))

commit_message:
Add '--share' and '--no-share' options to os network list command

This patch adds '--share' and '--no-share' options to filter
networks resulted by os network list command

Change-Id: I015c5000a79a5d9f72141872eb41ce823d7c7200
Partial-Bug: #1578819
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/76/350976/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_network_list_share(self): arglist = [ '--share', ] verifylist = [ ('long', False), ('share', True), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.networks.assert_called_once_with( **{'shared': True} ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data)) def test_network_list_no_share(self): arglist = [ '--no-share', ] verifylist = [ ('long', False), ('no_share', True), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.networks.assert_called_once_with( **{'shared': False} ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data))

Add '--name' options to os network list command

added_lines: def test_list_name(self): test_name = "fakename" arglist = [ '--name', test_name, ] verifylist = [ ('external', False), ('long', False), ('name', test_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # In base command class Lister in cliff, abstract method take_action() # returns a tuple containing the column names and an iterable # containing the data to be listed. columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.networks.assert_called_once_with( **{'name': test_name} ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data))

added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--admin-state-up', metavar='<admin_state_up>', choices=['True', 'False', 'true', 'false'], dest='enable', help=_("Filter and list the networks" "whose administrative state is active") ) args = {} if parsed_args.external: args['router:external'] = True if parsed_args.enable: args['admin_state_up'] = parsed_args.enable == 'True' or \ parsed_args.enable == 'true'
deleted_lines: if parsed_args.external: args = {'router:external': True} else: args = {}

commit_message:
Fix the members name in OpenDaylightLbaasDriverV2

Fix the members name in OpenDaylightLbaasDriverV2 to be
consistent with LoadBalancerBaseDriver.


Change-Id: Ie06a8033b42754eb5ad97c189ff8e6ddab096277
Closes-Bug: #1613562

commit_message:
Zh_CN_errormessage

In trove - dashboard/trove_dashboard/locale/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES
/django. Po, Line 157 Cannot disable root access: %s,"不能够即
你用root用户访问：%s,the translation is wrong, the meaning is
can't use the root user access, however, I think this is not
disable the root user access, so I made the change

Change-Id: Ia71be986b9e4ab9fa834e13fe3d4c160385ff74d

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-17 08:45:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/31057c508ff7118d2fe8c28d1bd360d58b9a9fcb', 'message': '[WIP]Subscription Confirmation Support for MongoDB

This patch is a part of subscription confirmation feature for
MongoDB. Other backends will be achieved in the follow patches.
This patch did and will do:
1. Add v2/queue/<queue_name>/subscription/<subscription_id>/confirm
endpoint.
2. Add two config option: "require_http(s)_confirmation" and
"require_email_confirmation".
3. Add a new property "is_confirmed" to subscription resource for
MongoDB driver.
4. Add a new policy "subscription: confirm".
5. Add a new property "message type" for message resource. (To be done)
6. Use pre-url in confirm request. (To be done).
7. Add the html example for confirm request. (To be done).
8. Add a new endpoint to allow re-confirm. (To be done).
9. Add test for the feature. (To be done).

Change-Id: Id38d4a5b4f9303b12e22e2b5c248facda4c00143
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support

9. Update notification for wsgi webhook subscription. (To be done)

'}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2016-06-01 12:42:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/9036f27c99d8151c9e7a6a55c6db87ad33f2be1e', 'message': '[WIP]Subscription Confirmation Support for MongoDB

The subscription confirmation feature will contain four patches:
1. webhook with mongoDB
2. email with mongoDB
3. webhook with redis
4. email with redis

This patch is the first part of subscription confirmation feature for
webhook with MongoDB. Others will be achieved in follow patches.

This patch did:
1. Add v2/queue/<queue_name>/subscription/<subscription_id>/confirm
endpoint.
2. Add three config options: "require_http(s)_confirmation" and
"require_email_confirmation".
3. Add a new property "is_confirmed" to subscription resource for
MongoDB driver.

3. webhook with redis
4. email with redis

This patch is the first part of subscription confirmation feature for
webhook with MongoDB. Others will be achieved in follow patches.

This patch did:
1. Add v2/queue/<queue_name>/subscription/<subscription_id>/confirm
endpoint.
2. Add a new config option: "require_confirmation".
3. Add a new property "confirmed" to subscription resource for
MongoDB driver.
4. Add a new policy "subscription: confirm".
5. Add a new property "message type" for notification.
6. Use the pre-signed url in confirm request.
8. Re-use POST subscription to allow re-confirm.
9. Update notification for webhook subscription with mongoDB.
10. Support unsubscrib the subscription
11. Add tests for the feature.
12. Add doc and sample.
Docimpact
APIimpact

Change-Id: Id38d4a5b4f9303b12e22e2b5c248facda4c00143
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support

commit_message:
Subscription Confirmation Support-1

The subscription confirmation feature will contain four patches:
1. webhook with mongoDB
2. email with mongoDB
3. webhook with redis
4. email with redis

This patch is the first part of subscription confirmation feature for
webhook with MongoDB. Others will be achieved in follow patches.

This patch did:
1. Add v2/queue/<queue_name>/subscription/<subscription_id>/confirm
endpoint.
2. Add a new config option: "require_confirmation".
3. Add a new property "confirmed" to subscription resource for
MongoDB driver.
4. Add a new policy "subscription: confirm".
5. Add a new property "message type" for notification.
6. Use the pre-signed url in confirm request.
8. Re-use POST subscription to allow re-confirm.
9. Update notification for webhook subscription with mongoDB.
10. Support unsubscrib the subscription
11. Add tests for the feature.
12. Add doc and sample.
Docimpact
APIimpact

Change-Id: Id38d4a5b4f9303b12e22e2b5c248facda4c00143
Implements: blueprint subscription-confirmation-support

We should allow them be # subscribed. if not sub.get('confirm', True): LOG.info(_LE('The subscriber %s is not ' 'confirmed' % sub['subscriber'])) continue

commit_message:
Pass on port_delete RPC call

The port_delete RPC call will now just pass as this is already
handled by our event based mechanism.

The agent will get an event when a VM nic is removed and as a result,
it will unbind the port, thus making the RPC call action redundant.

Change-Id: I850709adcc48a8fd0f9d9791e9e703d99764a115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/93/356993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
rt: Refactor unit test for trackable migrations

There was a functional test in test_resource_tracker.py call
test_no_move_type() that was setting up a resource tracker instance and
populating it only to test whether the migration's migration_type was
one of three that are tracked by the resource tracker.

This was silly, so I converted this into a real unit test, derived from
NoDBTestCase, in test_tracker.py and converted the
_is_trackable_migration() method on ResourceTracker to just be a
module-level method since it wasn't referencing self or anything.

Also added a unit test to ensure that when
_update_usage_from_migration(), is called with a non-tracked migration
(i.e. a live migration), we short-circuit and don't do anything.

Change-Id: I8a8dea0c8e2bcc689a7141bca53a1564325939bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/352610/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _is_trackable_migration(migration): # Only look at resize/migrate migration and evacuation records # NOTE(danms): RT should probably examine live migration # records as well and do something smart. However, ignore # those for now to avoid them being included in below calculations. return migration.migration_type in ('resize', 'migration', 'evacuation') if not _is_trackable_migration(migration):
deleted_lines: def _is_trackable_migration(self, migration): # Only look at resize/migrate migration and evacuation records # NOTE(danms): RT should probably examine live migration # records as well and do something smart. However, ignore # those for now to avoid them being included in below calculations. return migration.migration_type in ('resize', 'migration', 'evacuation') if not self._is_trackable_migration(migration):

commit_message:
Setup the gate to checkout the right amphora-agent

Currently the gate is checking out the master version of the
amphora agent when building the amphora image.  This patch will
cause Disk Image Builder (DIB) to checkout the correct reference
the patch under test.

Change-Id: I5df6fc3910cff2fd34b85113c52f89e04ca9ba6f

commit_message:
Move networking-ovn grenade CI job from experimental to check

Grenade job for OVN project is stable after the changes in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/343591/ got merged. The same can be
moved to the 'check' queue so that we can monitor the status of the migration
for every patch and fix it whenever it's broken.

This is still a non-voting job.

Change-Id: I73a03e7dacfecd3d270e854326361604bf75e9e7

commit_message:
fix python packaging

After the split, it is necessary to make the metadata that is used to
generate the egg name reflect that this repo is housing kuryr-lib and
not kuryr. Also, since the versioning is handled by pbr by checking
tags, I removed that field so the egg has also the good version number.

Change-Id: Ic4cf2aea9f90c68de649f566e0c3d7cd6abaab2c
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

deleted_lines: name = kuryr version = 0.1.0 summary = Docker libnetwork driver for OpenStack Neutron

commit_message:
Corrected success-pattern for npm-based doc builds

We use the upload-sphinx-draft build, which automatically puts the
output into /doc/build/html/.

Change-Id: If534e4614334473d8c230c4ace4bd42c5e7ad0ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/06/356606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: success-pattern: http://docs-draft.openstack.org/{build.parameters[LOG_PATH]}/doc/build/html/
deleted_lines: success-pattern: http://docs-draft.openstack.org/{build.parameters[LOG_PATH]}/dist/

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/b6583921f498c8ce0d1386e56252c9ec2a9bb548', 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Magnum already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ia4dbe462e3d416565c538361f0c4f06fd35c8ab4
Closes-Bug: #1608980
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Magnum already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ia4dbe462e3d416565c538361f0c4f06fd35c8ab4
Closes-Bug: #1608980

commit_message:
Fix revert order and pylint inspection

1) We should revert the master node before sending api requests
2) There is an issue in tox+distutils initialization so
inspection is useless

Change-Id: I017fc362eeed0c47cab154e2ac6bb122136e2502

commit_message:
Enhance upgrader tool with all-in-one yaml definition

Its difficult to use several files for one procedure so lets combine the data.
Yaml file was modified for including several steps for upgrade tests modification

Change-Id: I8cfe08299098bf890e032d93439e936f5f6b9c86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/08/356608/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from distutils.version import StrictVersionfrom proboscis import test, SkipTest from proboscis.asserts import assert_true, assert_equal for step in data: logger.debug("\n".join( ["{}:{}".format(key, value) for key, value in step.items()])) def _get_current_step(self): for item in self.upgrade_data: if item['action'] == 'backup': if self.env.d_env.has_snapshot(item['backup_snapshot_name']): continue else: return item elif item['action'] == 'restore': if self.env.d_env.has_snapshot(item['restore_snapshot_name']): continue else: return item raise SkipTest("All steps are executed, all snapshots are exists; " "Nothing to do") current_step = self._get_current_step() logger.info("Current step: {}".format(current_step['name'])) assert_equal( current_step['action'], 'backup', "Steps order incorrect! {!r} should be 'backup'".format( current_step['action'])) self.source_snapshot_name = current_step["source_snapshot_name"] self.backup_snapshot_name = current_step["backup_snapshot_name"] self.backup_name = current_step["backup_name"] self.repos_backup_name = current_step["repos_backup_name"] self.revert_source() assert_equal( StrictVersion(current_step['fuel_version']), self.fuel_version, "Wrong fuel version in current step; " "should be {!r}, actual {!r}".format( StrictVersion(current_step['fuel_version']), self.fuel_version)) # clean up existing files for avoiding "No space left" self.env.d_env.get_admin_remote().check_call( "rm -rf {}".format(self.remote_dir_for_backups)) current_step = self._get_current_step() assert_equal( current_step['action'], 'restore', "Steps order incorrect! {!r} should be 'restore'".format( current_step['action'])) self.backup_snapshot_name = current_step["backup_snapshot_name"] self.restore_snapshot_name = current_step["restore_snapshot_name"] self.backup_name = current_step["backup_name"] self.repos_backup_name = current_step["repos_backup_name"] self.show_step(1) assert_equal( StrictVersion(current_step['source_fuel_version']), self.fuel_version, "Wrong fuel version in current step; " "should be {!r}, actual {!r}".format( StrictVersion(current_step['source_fuel_version']), self.fuel_version)) self.revert_backup() self.env.d_env.resume() assert_equal( StrictVersion(current_step['target_fuel_version']), self.fuel_version, "Wrong fuel version in current step; " "should be {!r}, actual {!r}".format( StrictVersion(current_step['target_fuel_version']), self.fuel_version)) @test(groups=['upgrade_custom_tarball'], enabled=False) # TODO(vkhlyunev): revive this test when 6.0-8.0 will be implemented
deleted_lines: from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true logger.debug(''.join( ["{}:{}".format(key, value) for key, value in data.items()])) self.source_snapshot_name = data["source_snapshot_name"] self.backup_snapshot_name = data["backup_snapshot_name"] self.restore_snapshot_name = data["restore_snapshot_name"] self.tarball_remote_dir = data["tarball_remote_dir"] self.backup_name = data["backup_name"] self.repos_backup_name = data["repos_backup_name"] self.check_run(self.backup_snapshot_name) assert_true(self.source_snapshot_name) self.env.revert_snapshot(self.source_snapshot_name) self.check_run(self.restore_snapshot_name) self.show_step(1) assert_true(self.env.revert_snapshot(self.backup_snapshot_name)) self.env.d_env.resume() self.env.d_env.resume() @test(groups=['upgrade_custom_tarball'])

When we create the internal port on a nova server, we shouldn't pass

Change-Id: I0bb4407e89b5575dbaf8f198402e0926b550224d
Closes-Bug: #1607364
"}]
commit_message:
Don't pass value_specs when creating internal port

When we create the internal port on a nova server, we shouldn't pass
value_specs when specifying extra properties, as it's an internal
dictionary which is not accepted by the API.

Change-Id: I0bb4407e89b5575dbaf8f198402e0926b550224d
Closes-Bug: #1607364
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/09/348409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'value_specs': {},

commit_message:
Allow newer version of kafka-python

Currently supported version is from December 2015 and this is blocking me
for package newer version for Debian [1]
0.9 branch is not supported anymore

[1] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=834033

Change-Id: Id15da7a1ba2d387938f978e028a70cbaeb1d30d2

commit_message:
Imported Translations from Zanata

For more information about this automatic import see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations/Infrastructure

Change-Id: I371cb357a86e96c1fb4a65faf93915a6ffae6e6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/71/356971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-08-18 00:43+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-08-17 03:48+0000\n"msgid "Alternative term for an admin API." msgstr "管理员API的别称。" msgid "" "Enables Networking to distribute incoming requests evenly between designated " "instances." msgstr "启动网络服务来在指定实例间平均分发正在进入请求。" msgid "" "Enables a Linux bridge to understand a Networking port, interface " "attachment, and other abstractions." msgstr "使能Linux桥以理解网络服务端口，加载接口，和其他抽象概念。" msgid "" "For example, to see the version number for the ``openstack`` client, run the " "following command:" msgstr "例如，为了查看 openstack 客户端的版本号，运行以下命令：" msgid "LBaaS" msgstr "LBaaS" msgid "Layer-2 (L2) agent" msgstr "2层 (L2) 代理服务" msgid "Layer-3 (L3) agent" msgstr "3层 (L3) 代理服务" msgid "Liberty" msgstr "Liberty" msgid "Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)" msgstr "轻量目录访问协议（LDAP）" msgid "Linux Bridge neutron plug-in" msgstr "Linux Bridge neutron插件" msgid "Linux bridge" msgstr "Linux bridge" msgid "Linux containers (LXC)" msgstr "Linux容器（LXC）" msgid "M" msgstr "M" msgid "Run the following command to discover the version number for a client:" msgstr "运行以下命令来发现客户端的版本号" "Software that enables multiple VMs to share a single physical NIC within " "Compute." msgstr "使多个虚机共享一个计算服务中的物理NIC的软件。" msgid """The process of spreading client requests between two or more nodes to " "improve performance and availability." msgstr "将客户端请求分散到两个或多个节点来改善性能和可用性的进程。" msgid ""msgid "live migration" msgstr "热迁移" msgid "load balancer" msgstr "load balancer" msgid "load balancing" msgstr "load balancing" msgid "management API" msgstr "管理API" msgid "manager" msgstr "管理器" msgid "manifest" msgstr "manifest" msgid "maximum transmission unit (MTU)" msgstr "最大传输单元（MTU）" msgid "membership" msgstr "成员资格"

subject: Don't animate detached popovers for deployment history timeline
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 06:47:06.000000000', 'files': ['static/views/controls.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui/commit/a9fed854513a30aa438343c384817529cfcb3103', 'message': "Don't animate detached popovers for deployment history timeline

Animation causes issues with popovers when create a new popover
when the old one hasn't faded out.

Also, 'trigger' was removed from props since it's used only for
detached mode and always must be 'manual'.

Implements blueprint ui-deployment-history

Change-Id: I4843294ccc0a5e3acc91e6fcb2dc8f405ff70af4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't animate detached popovers for deployment history timeline

Animation causes issues with popovers when create a new popover
when the old one hasn't faded out.

Also, 'trigger' was removed from props since it's used only for
detached mode and always must be 'manual'.

Implements blueprint ui-deployment-history

Change-Id: I4843294ccc0a5e3acc91e6fcb2dc8f405ff70af4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/65/356965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: placement: React.PropTypes.node placement: 'bottom' animation: false, trigger: 'manual',
deleted_lines: placement: React.PropTypes.node, trigger: React.PropTypes.node placement: 'bottom', trigger: 'manual' trigger: this.props.trigger,

commit_message:
Change the method of checking if a lport is configured SG in SGApp

Because the SG default value in a lport was changed to a empty list,
SGApp should use 'not secgroups' rather than 'secgroups is None' to
check if this lport is configured SG.

Change-Id: Ifc58fc87cdb56e2fc011a0af0689dc8c61b26cfd
Closes-bug: #1613993

commit_message:
Perform str_replace trying to match longest string first

Purpose is to avoid str_replace from doing partial replace
when a shorter instance of a matching key is found.

Change-Id: I63c13f4eb3b1375cb2df1a34fd4f09561564f400
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1600209
(cherry picked from commit a2f5b5cb9ae74fb3262948b0cf1c23fc04c4b7cb)

commit_message:
Rework engine scheduler

This patch reworks engine scheduler to make it to work in "tickless"
way. The following changes were made:

 - Start_action method of scheduler is changed, it now always tries
   to acquire and schedule all actions in ready status;
 - Revise all existing calls for dispatcher.start_action in both
   service and cluster_action module: start_action rpc call is now
   being invoked without specifying action_id;
 - Notify scheduler only once after all node_create sub actions
   depdended by parent cluster_create action are ready since scheduler
   will try to schedule all of them automatically now.
 - Revise dispatcher.notify method to 1) broadcast start_action rpc
   call correctly, 2) use 'cast' rather than 'call' method to avoid
   blocking engine service for waiting for dispatcher's rpc response;
 - Use with_for_update to avoid race condition happens during action
   acquiring. Looks like current implementation of action_acquire db
   api can't avoid multiple engines locking the same action after
   they receive the start_action broadcast.

Change-Id: I5f6804b0ceb2341dcf2fa16c0f7d42972b7d6ae1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/43/312843/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '''Run action(s) in sub-thread(s). :param worker_id: ID of the worker thread; we fake workers using senlin engines at the moment. :param action_id: ID of the action to be executed. None means all ready actions will be acquired and scheduled to run. def launch(action_id): '''Launch a sub-thread to run given action.''' th = self.start(action_mod.ActionProc, self.db_session, action_id) self.workers[action_id] = th th.link(release, action_id) return th if action: launch(action.id) else: while True: action = db_api.action_acquire_1st_ready(self.db_session, worker_id, timestamp) # TODO(Yanyan Hu): Enable batch control. if action: launch(action.id) else: break
deleted_lines: '''Run the given action in a sub-thread. Release the action lock when the thread finishes? :param workder_id: ID of the worker thread; we fake workers using senlin engines at the moment. :param action_id: ID of the action to be executed. None means the 1st ready action will be scheduled to run. else: action = db_api.action_acquire_1st_ready(self.db_session, worker_id, timestamp) if not action: return th = self.start(action_mod.ActionProc, self.db_session, action.id) self.workers[action.id] = th th.link(release, action.id) return th

commit_message:
newton: release oslo.privsep 1.12.0

The main target is eadc1341ccd3401c240b58260fd0f04ce75e6a93
which fixes the problem with privsep doing gratuitous logging
at warning level for debug level events which clutters up
the service logs in our gate CI runs.

I figured this would be a minor version bump given the
behavior change in default logging.

Change-Id: Ib51d4c2bb0139241fd3b04da0eab0b54ed42a5cd

deleted_lines: `Home <index.html>`_ OpenStack-Ansible Installation Guide Add to existing deployment ========================== Complete the following procedure to deploy swift on an existing deployment. #. `The section called "Configure and mount storage devices" <configure-swift-devices.html>`_ #. `The section called "Configure an Object Storage deployment" <configure-swift-config.html>`_ #. Optionally, allow all keystone users to use swift by setting ``swift_allow_all_users`` in the ``user_variables.yml`` file to ``True``. Any users with the ``_member_`` role (all authorized keystone users) can create containers and upload objects to swift. If this value is ``False``, by default only users with the ``admin`` or ``swiftoperator`` role can create containers or manage tenants. When the backend type for the glance is set to ``swift``, glance can access the swift cluster regardless of whether this value is ``True`` or ``False``. #. Run the swift play: .. code-block:: shell-session # cd /opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks # openstack-ansible os-swift-install.yml -------------- .. include:: navigation.txt

[DOCS] Add storage architecture information

Add nova scheduler compute container location and network configuration
information.

Change-Id: I3d2241eadaa0e8502eb1e4f219b8a0701a555d49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/43/353743/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ephmeral Storage (nova) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The nova-scheduler container resides on the infra host. The nova-compute container resides on the compute host. Networking for Ephemeral Storage (nova) --------------------------------------- The nova-scheduler and nova-compute container communicate using the AMQP serivce over the management network ``br-mgmt``. The nova-compute container must be configured with the ``br-mgmt`` and ``br-storage``. The ``br-mgmt`` handles the API requests. The ``br-storage`` handles the transfer of data from the storage hosts to the compute host and vice-versa.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.2.2

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Change-Id: Ie17b82e27ed2b6df4ee451f075aefe25da26e4bf
Depends-On: I22aea1412d3ad1638a796b2d3a80e09dd222081e

commit_message:
Introduce ovo objects for security groups

Those objects are intentionally not integrated into the database code so
far. This is to quicken access to their definitions to implement
push-notifications for security groups and ports.

Expanded the list of possible values for IpProtocolEnumField to allow
port numbers in addition to symbolic names since security group API
supports both.

This patch also makes DeclarativeObject not override extra filters on
class creation and instead reuse the list of filters defined on the
class as an attribute. This allows to define it per class not per object
(in __init__).

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Change-Id: Idcdc928d37d5d661428525700001154f50c3056e
Co-Authored-By: Sayali Lunkad <sayali.lunkad@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>

commit_message:
Tox Upper Constraints - strip out reinstalls for remaining jobs

releasenotes and venv tox jobs had redefined the install_command
to reinstall any packages from requirements/test-requirements files.

Since Infra started supporting constrained requirements for these
jobs as well, we can drop the reinstall command.

Ref:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

Change-Id: Ib4b8c6cef22a9911030c2e3e3f5281e7e22575fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/55/355255/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jaegerandi): This target does not use constraints because # upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}# NOTE(jaegerandi): This target does not use constraints because # upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Change python version to 3.5

On Ubuntu Xenial there is no way to install python3.4
Use value specified in PYTHON3_VERSION

Change-Id: Ibc69b1c8270bdd240c82cf2acfdfd0730ef0f182
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/45/350645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apt_get install python${PYTHON3_VERSION} python${PYTHON3_VERSION}-dev
deleted_lines: apt_get install python3.4 python3.4-dev

subject: Include ServerAlias in dashboard vhost if set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 16:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'templates/default/dash-site.erb', 'spec/apache2-server_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-dashboard/commit/7a6de3ced6f08a926229814f8e6e39fb966ceaff', 'message': "Include ServerAlias in dashboard vhost if set

There are use cases where having ServerAlias in the vhost is preferred. This
includes that option but excludes by default. It's set using an array so you can
set multiple server aliases.

I also added the virtualhost port configurator test for dashboard-http-bind on
port 80 to ensure it works on both ports.

Change-Id: I621cb2a519e92d04d60fd75e727b59250bd72e30
"}]
commit_message:
Include ServerAlias in dashboard vhost if set

There are use cases where having ServerAlias in the vhost is preferred. This
includes that option but excludes by default. It's set using an array so you can
set multiple server aliases.

I also added the virtualhost port configurator test for dashboard-http-bind on
port 80 to ensure it works on both ports.

Change-Id: I621cb2a519e92d04d60fd75e727b59250bd72e30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-dashboard refs/changes/38/356038/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'server_aliases' do it 'sets the value if the server_aliases is present' do node.set['openstack']['dashboard']['server_aliases'] = %w(server_aliases_value) expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^#{virtualhost_directive}\s*ServerAlias server_aliases_value$/) end it 'sets the value if multiple server_aliases is present' do node.set['openstack']['dashboard']['server_aliases'] = %w(server_aliases_value1 server_aliases_value2) expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^#{virtualhost_directive}\s*ServerAlias server_aliases_value1 server_aliases_value2$/) end it 'does not set the value if the server_aliases is not present' do node.set['openstack']['dashboard']['server_hostname'] = [] expect(chef_run).not_to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^#{virtualhost_directive}\s*ServerAlias$/) end end it_should_behave_like 'virtualhost port configurator', 'dashboard-http-bind', 80

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: If4db21748c4cf2b457e02efdd92b33eee44e2319
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/19/355019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use memory mode for sqlite in db test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 06:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/unit/db/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/21633e4fb27c64aaa6b6c92d4f2c2644cf713b3f', 'message': 'Use memory mode for sqlite in db test

Config option sqlite_db is
deprecated in 0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and deprecate
argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use config option
connection instead. For zun, we test database with sqlite in memory

CONF.set_default('connection', "sqlite://", group='database')

and don't use config option sqlite_db, so remove unused code.

Change-Id: If962f63adca5b9635f8015031563fb144d873974

commit_message:
Use memory mode for sqlite in db test

Config option sqlite_db is
deprecated in 0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and deprecate
argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use config option
connection instead. For zun, we test database with sqlite in memory
mode [1] as below:

CONF.set_default('connection', "sqlite://", group='database')

and don't use config option sqlite_db, so remove unused code.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

Change-Id: If962f63adca5b9635f8015031563fb144d873974
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/47/355747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, db_api, db_migrate, sql_connection): self.setup_sqlite(db_migrate) self._DB = "".join(line for line in conn.connection.iterdump()) self.engine.dispose() conn = self.engine.connect() conn.connection.executescript(self._DB) self.addCleanup(self.engine.dispose) sql_connection=CONF.database.connection)
deleted_lines: import os import shutil from zun.common import paths def __init__(self, db_api, db_migrate, sql_connection, sqlite_db, sqlite_clean_db): self.sqlite_db = sqlite_db self.sqlite_clean_db = sqlite_clean_db if sql_connection == "sqlite://": self.setup_sqlite(db_migrate) elif sql_connection.startswith('sqlite:///'): testdb = paths.state_path_rel(sqlite_db) if os.path.exists(testdb): return self.setup_sqlite(db_migrate) else: db_migrate.upgrade('head') if sql_connection == "sqlite://": conn = self.engine.connect() self._DB = "".join(line for line in conn.connection.iterdump()) self.engine.dispose() else: cleandb = paths.state_path_rel(sqlite_clean_db) shutil.copyfile(testdb, cleandb) if self.sql_connection == "sqlite://": conn = self.engine.connect() conn.connection.executescript(self._DB) self.addCleanup(self.engine.dispose) else: shutil.copyfile(paths.state_path_rel(self.sqlite_clean_db), paths.state_path_rel(self.sqlite_db)) self.addCleanup(os.unlink, self.sqlite_db) sql_connection=CONF.database.connection, sqlite_db=CONF.database.sqlite_db, sqlite_clean_db='clean.sqlite')

commit_message:
Bumping bandit linter to 1.1.0

A security issue was discovered in bandit versions < 1.1.0 around
the HTML reporting mechanism. This patch bumps the version in
requirements to include a fix.

Change-Id: Ic3c3da0f3bbfba462234235510f342113b40dbfb
backport: mitaka
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/44/355444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bandit===1.1.0
deleted_lines: bandit===1.0.1

subject: Use http for Ironic deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 14:15:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/3b297255d44e8a3c1cf0026a46b77a35f67b8a8d', 'message': 'Use http for Ironic deployments

When conductor/api_url is not configured in ironic.conf, Ironic queries
keystone for the url. When using Undercloud ssl, this results in
deployments using ssl and IPA is not able to talk to Ironic over ssl
because it does not trust the certificate.

Previously, this was not the case, and it would choose the internal url
instead of the public url. But something has apparently changed
somewhere and the tripleo-ci promote jobs using undercloud ssl are now
failing to promote due to this issue.

To restore the previous behavior, this patch configures
conductor/api_url to use the internal endpoint.

Change-Id: Ib99b8a0bec3b8235a32dab4a67a448ec89707f8a
Closes-Bug: #1613088

deployments using ssl and IPA is not able to talk to Ironic over ssl
because it does not trust the certificate.

Previously, this was not the case, and it would choose the internal url
instead of the public url. But something has apparently changed
somewhere and the tripleo-ci promote jobs using undercloud ssl are now
failing to promote due to this issue.

To restore the previous behavior, this patch configures
conductor/api_url to use the internal endpoint.

Dependst-On: I558b53591b14ed43c725a4d0e0a67401adc7d2f0

Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use http for Ironic deployments

When conductor/api_url is not configured in ironic.conf, Ironic queries
keystone for the url. When using Undercloud ssl, this results in
deployments using ssl and IPA is not able to talk to Ironic over ssl
because it does not trust the certificate.

Previously, this was not the case, and it would choose the internal url
instead of the public url. But something has apparently changed
somewhere and the tripleo-ci promote jobs using undercloud ssl are now
failing to promote due to this issue.

To restore the previous behavior, this patch configures
conductor/api_url to use the internal endpoint.

Dependst-On: I558b53591b14ed43c725a4d0e0a67401adc7d2f0
Co-Authorized-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib99b8a0bec3b8235a32dab4a67a448ec89707f8a
Closes-Bug: #1613088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/84/355484/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ironic conductor # Force deployments to use http # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1613088 ironic_config: conductor/api_url: value: {{UNDERCLOUD_ENDPOINT_IRONIC_INTERNAL}}

commit_message:
Bump minimal versions of openstack_auth and osprofiler

Both requirements are needed by Horizon:
* django_openstack_auth is needed for the change
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330133/ to work for sure
* new version of osprofiler contains the support for MongoDB driver
  which the new Developer Profiler panel in Horizon relies on (see
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273085/).

Change-Id: I92fc12a96fa4b0fd90b6405ffcfb55cf25d2dbb4

commit_message:
allow hiding help-button for first ng workflow step

we have merged patch that will hide the help-button on
workflow steps if helpUrl is not defined
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/299705/

However, it forgot to factor in the 'first' step.
With this patch, you can see it used on its parent patch:
Create Volume action removed the helpUrl and the
helpBtn doesn't show up either.

Change-Id: I7e3ee4d03b9f5f1fa924d7f233e4fa4ea4ed12a7

deleted_lines: /** * Toggle help icon button if a step's helpUrl is not defined */ if (angular.isUndefined(steps[index].helpUrl)) { $scope.hideHelpBtn = true; } else { $scope.hideHelpBtn = false; } viewModel.ready = (stepReadyPromises.length === 0);

commit_message:
Stop stack tracing on 404s

Glance has had this persistent bit of log noise where trying to GET a
non existent image creates a stack trace at ERROR log level. This
makes glance api logs extra noisy, and confuses when actual errors
happen.

Change-Id: Ic08f3a3885f31433f2416e317b412e743512f797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/60/355960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't run probe tests if resetswift failed

Probe test is cleaning up the swift environment for each test in setUp
method. However, probe tests will run even if we cannot use the resetswift
script for some reasons (e.g. not permitted, the script not found) and
probably the probe tests will fail after a long time passed for the
execution.

To prevent such an unfortunate situation and also to find the reason
easily, this patch adds the exit code check for "resetswift" and if it
failed, the test will raise AssertionError with the stdout and stderr to
make it easy to find the reason.

Closes-Bug: #1613494

Change-Id: Id80d56ab6b71402ead4fe22c120064d78c1e74ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/87/355687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if p.returncode: raise AssertionError( 'Cleanup with "resetswift" failed: stdout: %s, stderr: %s' % (stdout, _stderr))

commit_message:
Remove the test_upload_large_objects negative test

The test_upload_large_objects test that is part of the
test_account_quotas_negative.py has been skipped for 2 years now,
and there is no way to run this test in a reliable way since all the
container and account updates are done by background daemons running
in the cluster somewhere.
This commit removes the test from Tempest since it is a test that
won't be run anymore.

Change-Id: Id3917003f0cf3c0ab652c9ea16d22c696f52933f
Closes-Bug: 1310597

commit_message:
Extracted common ldap setup and use in the filter tests

The common setup was taken from the BaseLDAPIdentity class as it holds
the setup for almost all of the LDAP tests. The goal is to make the
setup easier to follow. Currently it's hard to tell what happens during
setup...for instance, why is load_backends() called twice for some test
cases and three times for other?

Change-Id: I14dc4a2dc0d70fceef98bc5b6ab2103dddb54638

commit_message:
Set PS4 to provide additional debug info

Add:
export PS4='+ ${BASH_SOURCE:-}:${FUNCNAME[0]:-}:L${LINENO:-}:   '

To devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh to provide additional debug info.  This will
show the filename, line number, function name, and the content of the
line.

Same as how it is done in openstack/devstack

An example output line:
+ ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh:main:L547:   RETVAL=1

Change-Id: I2c745fd139be63d56ff89ab8e3f60eb795ab82ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/34/271434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When doing xtrace (set -x / set -o xtrace), provide more debug output export PS4='+(${BASH_SOURCE}:${LINENO}): ${FUNCNAME[0]:+${FUNCNAME[0]}(): }'

subject: Add debug option to verify iptables rules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 06:43:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bf443baa789c626092acd0112466751a5abc48a4', 'message': "Add option to validate iptables rules

The iptables apply logic performs diffs between the rules in the
system and the desired rule state. If the format generated in
Neutron does not match the format of iptables-save, Neutron will
generate unnecessary deletions and adds for rules that it thinks
are different when they are actually the same.

A simple way to detect mismatches is to run the _apply function
twice each time and generate an error if the second one results
in changes since that implies that the rules the first one applied
did not match the format of iptables-save. However, this comes at
a performance cost and doesn't offer benefits to operators.

This patch adds a config option to verify_iptables_rules that
is set to False by default. When set to True it will perform
the secondary check described above.

The intention is that this value be set to True in the gate
jobs to prevent incorrect formatted iptables rules from merging.

commit_message:
Add debug option to verify iptables rules

The iptables apply logic performs diffs between the rules in the
system and the desired rule state. If the format generated in
Neutron does not match the format of iptables-save, Neutron will
generate unnecessary deletions and adds for rules that it thinks
are different when they are actually the same.

A simple way to detect mismatches is to run the _apply function
twice each time and generate an error if the second one results
in changes since that implies that the rules the first one applied
did not match the format of iptables-save. However, this comes at
a performance cost and doesn't offer benefits to operators.

This patch adds a config option to debug_iptables_rules that
is set to False by default. When set to True it will perform
the secondary check described above.

This enables it for all of the jobs that call the gate_hook.sh
script.

This is only meant to assist catching development errors of
iptables, it SHOULD NOT be turned on by operators.

Change-Id: I6bee1d51155488e91857ee8bc45470d6a224fa37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/348753/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('verify_iptables_rules', default=False, help=_("Duplicate every iptables difference calculation to " "ensure the format being generated matches the format " "of iptables-save. This option should only be used " "when developing Neutron.")),

commit_message:
Validate the input/output configs in Software Config

When the only way to define a Software Config was via a Heat resource, the
input and output configs were validated by the properties of the resource.
However, subsequently a REST API to create Software Configs directly was
added. That means that configs created in this way do not have the contents
of the inputs and outputs sections validated. This change adds validation
to ensure that the configs always follow the correct schema.

Change-Id: I8c66bb82484b75723524959be753a4cd20c0f84d

commit_message:
[api] add blurb about experimental status

Taken mostly from the http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref.html,

commit_message:
Rename NeutronServer to NeutronApi to align with ServiceNetMap

The new composable service name conflicts with the existing ServiceNetMap
naming, so align with NeutronApi since ServiceNetMap exists in current
released versions.

This is required so we can correctly generate the neutron_api_node_ips
list (needed by puppet-tripleo) based on the service_name.

Change-Id: Ic1d45cbaa77bc6ac9ca247c880a9845ca49905da
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Add release notes for 0.17.0

Besides the configuration help text enhancements, there has been removal
of the deprecated exceptions.

This commit adds a release note for the same.

Change-Id: Ib0d6b67eaa03437daf819d52926aaded1a59fe19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/81/356781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Some deprecated exceptions have been removed. See upgrade section for more details. upgrade: - The following list of exceptions have been deprecated since 0.10.0 release -- ``Conflict``, ``ForbiddenPublicImage`` ``ProtectedImageDelete``, ``BadDriverConfiguration``, ``InvalidRedirect``, ``WorkerCreationFailure``, ``SchemaLoadError``, ``InvalidObject``, ``UnsupportedHeaderFeature``, ``ImageDataNotFound``, ``InvalidParameterValue``, ``InvalidImageStatusTransition``.

commit_message:
Release note for glance_store configuration opts.

Adding a release note stating the work on improving configuration
options of Glance store for this release.
Some of the configuration options in Glance store were set
with a ``min``, preventing them to accept negative integers like
in the previous release. This release note will give operators a
heads up on this.

Change-Id: I8db8764f84c92e987a774ce3650beb53d9635905
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/89/356589/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - The glance_store configuration options have been improved with more explanative help texts, sample defaults, choices to easily pick from, and a well defined range for the values with ``min`` and ``max`` set. It is to be noted that the configuration options for which a ``min`` value has been set to zero or greater, eliminates the ability of it to accept negative integer values. Operators need to verify that the values provided to such configuration options comply with the ``min`` value, while using of old configuration files that might have negative integer values for such configuration options.

commit_message:
Add a callback registry event for the init process - before spawning

The current PROCESS AFTER_INIT event (or AFTER_CREATE) are being called
multiple times, once for each process.
In case we want to perform an action only once after init, we would need a
callback that is called after init is done, but before spawning.

Usage examples can be:
- A plugin/driver needs to configure something at the backend after init is done
- A plugin/driver needs to create an object in one of the neutron tables
(add a network for example)

Change-Id: I249ba32dede16e61b1c757a8010dac610484da4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/337080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Router namespace not created in controller".

Issue has been fixed in Neutron. See patch
https://review.openstack.org/290470

This reverts commit 7334c3cfee12a81657296fa0e90c7d25457de9f6.

Change-Id: I0889106367ef0723ea955b09623b804e9b4e76b9
(cherry picked from commit bb38c597775704676f7eb2478c4db47a88ff8d21)

deleted_lines: # workaround for neutron bug #1535707 try: if ('external_network' in data and data['external_network']): api.neutron.router_add_gateway(request, router['id'], data['external_network']) message = _('Router %s was successfully created.') % data['name'] messages.success(request, message) return router except Exception: try: api.neutron.router_delete(request, router['id']) message = _('Router %s was created but connecting to' ' an external network failed. The created' ' router has been deleted, as the overall' ' operation failed.') % data['name'] LOG.info(message) redirect = reverse(self.failure_url) exceptions.handle(request, message, redirect=redirect) return False except Exception: message = _('Router %(name)s was created but connecting to' ' an external network failed. Attempts to' ' delete the new router also failed.' ' Router %(name)s still exists but is not connect' ' to the desired external network.') % { 'name': data['name']} LOG.info(message) redirect = reverse(self.failure_url) exceptions.handle(request, message, redirect=redirect) return False

commit_message:
Drop X-Auth-Token from all versioned_writes subrequests

It is not necessary for versioned_writes to function (all of these
were pre-authed requests anyway), and transaction ID should be used to
trace requests instead.

Change-Id: If55c1586aa38f9a3bc9e1d00768ca00201af94cd

subject: In placement API send microversion header when error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 16:10:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/microversion.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/microversion.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2f7109764c9c1147a1b63cd341ed4b15c5a3c5e9', 'message': 'In placement API send microversion header when error

If there is an exception in the placement API application we still
need to send the openstack-api-version header in the response:
errors are versioned too. Therefore catch the exception, add to its
headers and then reraise the exception.

This was a problem identified in the review of the initial framing
of the placement API but left for a later patch. This is that later
patch.

Change-Id: Ib83acbf74907fd9dcbdd4b0a9271ad4bae1c21b1
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
'}]
commit_message:
In placement API send microversion header when error

If there is an exception in the placement API application we still
need to send the openstack-api-version header in the response:
errors are versioned too. Therefore catch the exception, add to its
headers and then reraise the exception.

This was a problem identified in the review of the initial framing
of the placement API but left for a later patch. This is that later
patch.

Change-Id: Ib83acbf74907fd9dcbdd4b0a9271ad4bae1c21b1
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/356036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: microversion = extract_version(req.headers) req.environ[MICROVERSION_ENVIRON] = microversion microversion_header = '%s %s' % (SERVICE_TYPE, microversion) try: response = req.get_response(self.application) except webob.exc.HTTPError as exc: # If there was an error in the application we still need # to send the microversion header, so add the header and # re-raise the exception. exc.headers.add(Version.HEADER, microversion_header) raise exc response.headers.add(Version.HEADER, microversion_header)
deleted_lines: req.environ[MICROVERSION_ENVIRON] = extract_version( req.headers) response = req.get_response(self.application) response.headers.add(Version.HEADER, '%s %s' % (SERVICE_TYPE, req.environ[MICROVERSION_ENVIRON]))

commit_message:
Revise Synology DSM storage driver

This patch addressed last comments from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335870/, including:
1. Add an exception message for SynoAuthError
2. Change time.sleep to eventlet.sleep
3. Report reserved_percentage from cinder.conf
4. Report provisioned_capacity_gb and max_over_subscription_ratio in
update_volume_stats

Closes-Bug: #1602942
Co-Authored-By: Taylor Huang<taylorh@synology.com>

Change-Id: I0ab0b8ab651830412bad87a0fe5d9ac8a601aacb

commit_message:
Raise 501 instead of 500 when updating meter-lebel and rule

Currently, there is no action for updating meter-label and rule.
Thus, InternalServerError is returned to user because of
unexpected internal AttributeError.
This patch defines action for updating meter-label and rule
so that user can see NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I7b179b2179a3e6cef0fd53df8f59fb6fb9433d40
Closes-Bug: #1607172

commit_message:
Remove embedded CSS

As follow on work to restoring the old network topology, this patch
separates embedded CSS in one of the html files into a separate SCSS
file.

This change is not intended to make topology themable.  There is still
much work that needs to be done and will follow up soon.

Change-Id: I46b7152a24fc1f7a26a1752ba22d80e31ff1ffdb

commit_message:
Fix the Ubuntu Xenial build gate

Ubuntu xenial use systemd service manager. Change the setup_Debian.sh
script to handle this.

Change-Id: I1f6487b73b1635e6dce0c68d3d7e1a158b427797
Partial-Bug: #1612887
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/74/355274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source /etc/lsb-release echo "deb http://apt.dockerproject.org/repo ubuntu-${DISTRIB_CODENAME} main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.listif [[ ${DISTRIB_CODENAME} == "trusty" ]]; then echo 'DOCKER_OPTS="-s btrfs"' | sudo tee /etc/default/docker sudo mount --make-shared /run sudo service docker start else sudo mkdir /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/kolla.conf << EOF [Service] ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd --storage-driver btrfs MountFlags=shared EOF sudo systemctl daemon-reload sudo systemctl start docker fi
deleted_lines: echo 'deb http://apt.dockerproject.org/repo ubuntu-trusty main' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.listecho 'DOCKER_OPTS="-s btrfs"' | sudo tee /etc/default/docker sudo mount --make-shared /run sudo service docker start

commit_message:
Move the keystone_*_url variable from common role to group vars

keystone_*_url are cross role variables. They are used in multi roles.
Move them from the common role to the group vars

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If451823ed7612bfec7bc797ec9dd2597164c6804

commit_message:
Skips a debug log during image build

Added a condition to skip debug message during image build, when the 
base image is dependent on image of other service

Closes-Bug: #1513904. 
  
Change-Id: I68d568981cebf442b34c958e125b0f921b883247

commit_message:
Fix tar command path for magnum conductor using ubuntu

In ubuntu, the tar binary path is /bin/tar instead of /usr/bin/tar.
Change to use tar directly for all os.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I12562d3ac186acab651ffae715e5c7788cd98b7e
